Reviews.Content: Husband's D80 had an unfortunate encounter with a bucking boat on 30 foot swells.  So I got him the D90 to replace it. He has loved the features and capabilities of both cameras--the D90 being newer tech, taking even better photos.

Reviews.Title: I love my new camera
Reviews.Author: Reven
Reviews.Content: Compared so much between D5100 and D7100 and this one, I finally chose it, and it doesn't disappoint me! Much better than the D3100 I had before.

Reviews.Title: This camera has a ton of bells and whistles and is a fun camera that produces great pictures. I like it very much.
Reviews.Author: Louis H. Fields, Jr.
Reviews.Content: This is my third Nikon camera. I have been trying a lot of new things with this camera.  I am very impressed with thiscamera and I am just in the beginning stages of using many of the advanced features.  The camera is really greatand I will be able to report more information in a couple of months.

Reviews.Title: This is a good product and good service
Reviews.Author: Shuqing Li
Reviews.Content: I am glad to use this camera and satisfied to it. Although it is used one, it still work well and look good. And the seller'service is also very good. He give me all the necessary things for me to use it such as SD card or cables.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ed Martin
Reviews.Content: It was my first purchase of a reflex camera, I was really worth it... Easier to use than I expected, and great results

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: AJ
Reviews.Content: ive worked with the D90 in the past witch is why i wanted one of my own .. i think this one is perfect works way better then the one i was using it was a great purchase

Reviews.Title: Needed another camera body
Reviews.Author: Linda Hulsey
Reviews.Content: Needed to upgrade and get 2nd camera. Enjoy this camera body with other lenses so I am able to have 2 camera bodies.

Reviews.Title: No bad
Reviews.Author: kAI
Reviews.Content: Door of memory card is broken and the screen is sketched, but the rest is good. I like the camera.

Reviews.Title: Worthful DSLR
Reviews.Author: Ashok
Reviews.Content: I just upgraded my D40 with D90.  The body is big and we have more controls over than D40. I don't see much difference in this new upgrade.  Better don't need to upgrade those who don't need more mega pixel & movie feature.  I could get good pictures in D40.  They could improve D-movie feature more professional.  I see more issues while recording D-movie (Flickers,Noises,Auto focus,More heat on battery side,more vibrations)  But Still it works good on taking photographs.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: BobbyG
Reviews.Content: I could not be happier with my purchase.  This is my first DSLR and I made an excellent choice.  I highly recomment this camera.

Reviews.Title: A Challenge for Beginners - In a Good Way!
Reviews.Author: Veronika
Reviews.Content: This camera offers a lot of possibilities for people interested in improving their photography skills. By default, the pictures turn out amazing and with a little more knowledge about the camera functions they will be even better. You need to be interested in semi-professional photography otherwise this model is a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: An Amateur but love to take picture and aspiring to be a professional.
Reviews.Author: Yojalma M M "_.-PHOTO-._"
Reviews.Content: It is a bit too heavy and i wish that the grips were rubber.But i absolutely love it.

Reviews.Title: D90 - the best DSLR to learn advance photography
Reviews.Author: sharnity
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera since April 2010 along with 18-55mm, 70-300mm and 50mm 1.8 lens and am almost satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Matthew P. Lobur
Reviews.Content: Where to start, this camera is amazing, it is very user friendly (after a brief review of the manual), very accessible because you don't have to access the menu every 2 seconds to change the seconds, simply use the turn dials on front and back, and the pictures are simply amazing.  Even an amateur coming from a point and shoot can benefit 10 fold from this camera, simply amazing

Reviews.Title: Maheba's Review
Reviews.Author: Mahesh B. Shanmugam "mahebabush"
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the purchase. The D90 works exceptionally effective and to my expectations.  The picture quality is amazing and nothing like I have seen before from my own photographs taken.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D90 Digital SLR
Reviews.Author: D. V. Stone "Lead Telecom Tech"
Reviews.Content: There is not much else I can add to the many reviews already out there regarding this truly excellent camera.  It takes incredible pictures, it is super sharp, fast 4.5 fps, 720 HD video mode, NIKON build and quality, Excellent display, very flexible platform.  This camera will get as detailed and as manual control as you want and also do fully automatic as well.  I love it and am extremely happy with it.Get the camera you won't be sorry.  This camera is so much more advanced and beyond my old Nikon D50 DSLR I hardly shoot it anymore.  You want it, you know it, just buy it, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D90
Reviews.Author: John M. O'Connor "jmoc"
Reviews.Content: I am a Nikon aficianado...enthusiast photographer...used since NewYear w/ 18-200mm VR II...unbeatable combination...wonderful low-light ability...very little if any noise at highest ISO settings...auto-focus is right-on...most all settings "tweakable" to your liking...really nice level of in camera photo-editing...best camera I have ever owned...will be purchasing another w/ 70-300mm VR...Amazon was the best deal...had very good combo price w/ 18-200mm at Christmas time...by the way, did I mention?, that I love this Camera & Lens...!!!

Reviews.Title: First DSLR  - like it so far
Reviews.Author: L. Yang
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR. Compare to all the other point and shot cameras I have owned, this is certainly not for portability. But the pictures is so much sharper and faster. It worth the weight. Actually, it is one of the light weight DSLR I have seen.I am still learning all the advance features... ...

Reviews.Title: Pro quality photos in a consumer package
Reviews.Author: K. Ulrich
Reviews.Content: The D90 offers great photo quality in an easy to use consumer style camera.  The camera accepts our older pro lenses with mechanical auto focus as well as the newer AF-S version lenses.  I can tell a difference in the new CMOS sensor as higher ISO photos are much clearer.Highly recommended for someone that wants a smaller DSLR with big camera performance.

Reviews.Title: GREAT VALUE
Reviews.Author: M. Maskiell
Reviews.Content: I have really enjoyed learning photography with this tool.  Enough options to keep the learning continuous; simple enough to set a few things and have a great weekend shooting photos.  The Nikon image managing software is a great value as well.

Reviews.Title: For my son who's and excellent photographer!
Reviews.Author: Leslie Arrington "Leslie"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our son who is 23 and a talented photographer.  He has an assortment of lenses and takes professional quality pics with it.  It's your basic Nikon that has endless possibilities.  Sonny boy loves it!

Reviews.Title: from d80 to d90
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Ortiz
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera as an upgrade from a D80. While the D80 is a great box, the D90 is worth the extra investment.

Reviews.Title: Simply excellent!
Reviews.Author: Jorge O. Tocora "nOmada"
Reviews.Content: This camera is so nice in its picture quality and has a vast array of image control. I've just downloaded profiles that emulates Kodak Vision 2, Kodachorme, Extachrome, Velvia plus many others. I could keep going on and on but this only feature makes it worth. Video is a bit noisy but it depends if you're controlling lighting. Don't regret a bit about this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas Dwyer "TD BAYSIDE"
Reviews.Content: The Nikon D90 is outstanding. My family can't believe the pictures that I'm taking since I got the camera. The camera has a lot of bells and whistles. It's takes a good time learning the camera but it's worth it. Would recommend this camera for anybody that enjoys a well constructed camera.

Reviews.Title: Must add a 5 star
Reviews.Author: Brett
Reviews.Content: The first few reviews sum this camera up pretty well.  I love my camera, and I purposely chose this camera over the more expensive D300.

Reviews.Title: Awsome camera - brings life to pictures.....
Reviews.Author: Gurmeet Singh
Reviews.Content: I have owned many cameras like many of you including some of the latest slim designs - they are all great to carry around but I think one doesn't knwo what quality of picture unless one uses this beast.  It has given us more reasons to take picture and it excellent response time is a pleasure to capture real moments.BTW, I am not an expert but number of complements I have got for my pictures are mind blowing - we also took pictures along side experts in Disney world recently and it so turns out our pictures are order of magnitude better than what they could do......Only downside of this beast is its size - carrying this around is not easy but for now we are choosing a great experience and output versus convenience......if money is not an object this is the camera to go for - both for casual photographers as well as for professionals...

Reviews.Title: A solid Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Weinheimer "Mr. Do It"
Reviews.Content: I have been having a great time learning about this camera and using it for nature photos and some scientific images capturing fast action.  Really enjoy the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon D90 Digital SLR Very very cool
Reviews.Author: Carla M. Goodhart "cmgoodhart"
Reviews.Content: just got my D90, received 2 days after purchasing, day 4 cant put it down .LOVE IT!!!! Lots to learn, as this camera offers quite a bit of pre and post pic enhancing, with multiple multiple features.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the enthuisiast.
Reviews.Author: personaV
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my wife because she has an unexplored interest in photography, and she absolutely loves it.  She went from not knowing the difference between iso and aperture to being able to fine tune the camera to get the image she wanted.  The shots are far from perfect but they definitely have a beautiful professional look to them.I work in video and film production and so i have a great appreciation for the tremendous level of control the camera gives you.  Huge iso/shutter ranges, it would be nice to have a quicker lens though.  We have figured out a majority of the controls thanks to the easily accessible manual and quick manual and good old fashioned playing around.The best part we've found is that even without painstakingly setting manual settings the camera takes beautiful pictures on it's automatic settings.  Our real gems up to this point have come from manual settings, but that just means we have lots of room to improve.An SDHC card is a good addition for quick read/write functionality.This is a fantastic camera to help the photography enthuisiast or professional to create stunning photos well above it's price.

Reviews.Title: Great shooter
Reviews.Author: Nick A. Spang
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I've been shooting with point-and-shoots for years, opting for the Canon Digital Elph line of cameras.  The limitations of the point-and-shoots in action sequences, low light, or difficult lighting became too frustrating, so I finally made the plunge and bought a D-90.  The camera is beautifully capable of handing all the situations I find myself in, for example hiking, at parties, cycling, and for portraits.  The ability to shoot at 4.5 fps, take photos in low light, and adjust any function on the fly to try different approaches have made my experience of photography much more gratifying.

Reviews.Title: Best so far!!
Reviews.Author: Pradeep Nagaraj "Srinivas"
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera. Photos are of extreme high quality. Settings are easy. I just love it.The only negative that i can think of is the video quality - it is not comparable to the camcorders.Rest all awesome.. i go with 5 stars for this beauty.

Reviews.Title: I love it!!
Reviews.Author: L. Tieng "Lt gee"
Reviews.Content: This is my second DSLR, i just upgraded from a d60. The first thing i noticed was the LCD screen, it was bigger than the d60. This is a big upgrade from a d60 when i comes to features such as ISO, ease of use,image quality. My suggestion is to try it out in a retail store and see for yourself. I loved this camera so much that i did not miss my d60.

Reviews.Title: Great for the semi-pro
Reviews.Author: Happy & Retired "islandtime"
Reviews.Content: I have a D40 and a D60 and was about to purchase a D5000, but after looking at all the reviews I could find of each model, I chose to add the D90 to my collection...so glad I did. The quality is great for the price, and the pictures are amazing. I have added a wide angle (11-18) lens and I am so impressed with the results. I belong to a retro Thunderbird club, and getting 70 T-Birds in a clear concise photo was a major concern. Even large prints of the pics I took are of poster quality...which means, blown up, much detail can be seen. Great camera!

Reviews.Title: Nikon D90 Meets All Expectations
Reviews.Author: Chris F. Hallmark
Reviews.Content: My previous digital camera was a Canon Powershot (an excellent little camera) which I've had for several years. Prior to my vacation to Colorado this year, I wanted to invest in a serious digital SLR. After studying reports, handling different cameras at the local retailers, and talking to acquaintances about their cameras, I decided on the Nikon D90 with the 18-105 VR kit lens. I also purchased the 70-300 VR zoom lens in anticipation of the wildlife that is prevalent where I was going. It took me a couple of days to become familiar with the features and capabilities of the camera, which are very impressive. The controls and menus are intuitive and the 3" Hi-res viewing monitor is a joy to work with. The results on the trip more than met my expectations. The vibration reduction feature of both lenses worked well and my hand-held shots were crisp. The one aspect of the purchase that is less than stellar is the Nikon software program supplied to organize and view the photos.

Reviews.Title: This camera lives up to all its expectations
Reviews.Author: D. C. Van Lauwe
Reviews.Content: This is my first SLR digital, having owned several small Canon's digital camera's.  I bought the Nikon because of the interchangability of many of their older lenses and other customers and professionals evaluations.The menu system and LCD on rear of camera are excellent. I recommend a UV filter for lense protection and electronic remote.

Reviews.Title: Nikon d90
Reviews.Author: Matthew Chavez
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! Easy to use and it takes excellent pictures. I recommend getting a 50mm 1.8 lens in addition to the "kit" zoom lens. Because the camera is not a "full frame" the 50mm acts like a portrait lens and takes awesome portrait pictures.

Reviews.Title: Stunning, beautiful photos!
Reviews.Author: J. Casalino
Reviews.Content: I'm officially in love with this camera.  I moved up from a Canon point and shoot.  The photos I've taken so far are fantastic!  The learning curve of this camera is definitely not for a beginner, but the Auto modes do help quite a bit.  I've realized just how many different ways there are to royally mess up a photo!The kit lens (18-105mm) is suitable for most situations, but lacks the length to really zoom in on something far away.  Macro shots work nicely with this lens, as do portraits and landscapes.  Fireworks were no problem with a tripod, but shooting a wedding hand-held at dusk/twilight was too much for the slower f/3.5-5.6 lens, even with VR turned on.  Had to use a flash as it got darker.My next purchase will probably be a 50mm f/1.4 prime lens for faster shots and more crisp portraits, then the 105mm Micro-Nikkor for macro shots.

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong with Nikon!
Reviews.Author: P. Kumar "Ptpk"
Reviews.Content: This camera is currently one of the best mid range DSLRs out there. It has everything that an advanced amateur requires. It's also a great camera for a pro to use as a back up. The image quality with the 18-105 lens is brilliant and is as good if not better than it's big brother the D300.I gave this camera only 4/5 stars is because of three reasons. First, the weight. It's definitely one of the heaviest cameras in it's range. The Canons are so much lighter. Second, the battery lid is flimsy and looks like it hasn't been fixed properly. I don't know if this is the case in all their cameras or only mine. Third, it's quite expensive when compared to it's competitors. It would have been nice if this camera had been priced about 150 - 200 dollars lesser than it's current price. Do get it with the Lowepro Slingshot AW 100. It compliments the camera very well. Without a doubt Nikon has mastered the art of manufacturing the best cameras and I would strongly recommend buying this product.

Reviews.Title: Nikon fan
Reviews.Author: Steven D. Cunningham "photobugd90"
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the camera.  Have owned several Nikon's (going back to an old F years ago.)  Was able to use my existing lenses, no problems with the product being a refurb.  Highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Need to go back in time a few years
Reviews.Author: Thomas Stark
Reviews.Content: ..because I've wasted them on point-and-shoot cameras.  So many missed opportunities and grainy low light shots.  No more with this camera, especially when coupled with the inexpensive 50mm/f1.8 lens.  Although I am attempting to learn to fully utilize the camera, I was very concerned that just using auto mode would not work any better than a point-and-shoot.  To put it mildly, I was wrong.  If you are considering leaping into the DSLR world, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great for Me (a beginner)
Reviews.Author: E. Faust "Betsy"
Reviews.Content: I did alot of reaserch before i chose this camera. And i am so glad i did. It is everything the articals and amazon told me it would be.I am a amiture photographer and love shooting outside. I could not have chosen a better camera. I love that with the lens you can be in Auto mode (for regular family photos) and then change to manual (for the great art shots) I am very happy with this camera.Just remember it is like a set of lego's. you always want more! Another lens or another filter or a different strap. Try and pace yourself and see what other people have before you get sucked into the Photographers black hole of buying equipment.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this
Reviews.Author: M. Dinh
Reviews.Content: I am pretty new to Semi-Pro DSLR camera, so I'm not gonna write much on this review but few impressions about this camera.Bit Heavy, Lousy, 12bit RAW, heavily compressed JPEG.butEasy to Use, Professional Look, Relative Fast Shutter Speed, Fast FocusI just love it!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Bill "landguitar"
Reviews.Content: This was my first digital SLR, and it is SO easy to use, and takes great pictures.  However, I should have listened to other advice, as I returned it - and Amazon gave me a full refund, yaay Amazon - because I am getting the same camera with the 18-200 mm lens.  The 105 is fine, no issues other than the zoom is just not quite long enough.I found the D90 easy to set up, easy and intuitive to use the button functions on the camera without going into the menus, even to do some basic manual adjustments.  Glad I decided on it rather than the Canon.  The shutter speed is great, caught lots of good action shots, exposure was good except for user error, rear lcd screen very clear and nice, flash great - can't wait to get my new one with the better lens!

Reviews.Title: Nikon D90
Reviews.Author: M. Platt
Reviews.Content: This camera is the best camera I have ever owned.  It was everything I expected and even more.  I would recommend this camera to anyone interested in improving their photography and adding a whole new level to it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing....
Reviews.Author: Jonathan A. Campos
Reviews.Content: Love love love it!!!! What can I say that hasn't already been said? This camera is all types of win!!!!

Reviews.Title: What else could you need???
Reviews.Author: Genaro Goyzueta Jr.
Reviews.Content: Nikon D90 DX 12.3MP Digital SLR Camera with 18-105mm f/3.5-5.6G ED AF-S VR DX Nikkor Zoom LensLove at first shot! flawless and breathtaking photographs and the very first DSLR with movie mode!!, ok ok is 720p, but, what else could anyone need?, Oh by the way! Nikon=300dpi, Canon=72dpi. Nikon is ALL about quality, Do the math!!!Happy Shooting!

Reviews.Title: Good Pictures
Reviews.Author: Missaigon
Reviews.Content: I just bought Nikon D-90 from Amazon.com about 2 weeks ago. It's great camera. I took photos on the Lunar New Year's Eve - Sunday Jan 25/2009 at a Asian temple. With this camera I enjoyed some photos taken in low light condition like that evening. I didn't have to wait as I took photos with a small digital camera. I have not tried movie yet.

Reviews.Title: I Love the D90
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Richardson "kricha"
Reviews.Content: So Far, I have had my D90 for a Day and I LOVE IT I have spent over 20 years using both Film and DSLR's, and personally HATED Film Cameras all because there were times when my pictures just didn't come out like I wanted, and personally and literally had a whole blasted Roll screwed up by CVS Pharmacy, AND IT WAS DONE DELIBERATELY, NO ACCIDENT! And I have never taken another roll back to them, VACATION PHOTOS AT THAT. So when Digital Slr's started coming out, you can bet I bought me one, a Pentax ist DL about 5 or so years ago, sold it to my brother, who gave it to my Sister and brother in-law, and I bought a Nikon D40 in its place, then a Canon Rebel XSI after a year or so. then within six months of that bought a Nikon D60, then decided I would much rather have the D90, and proceeded to trade the D60 and XSI in, kept the D40 (centimental reasons) and I now have a Nikon D40 and a Nikon D90.Now what made me choose a D90? simple The HUGE 41 Custom Menu was a plus for me, 2nd the rave reviews of the picture quality, 3rd would have to the Low Noise up and down the ISO range, even at 6400 is good. 4th I would have bought me a Pentax K7 because of its huge improvement in WB mode, and other ares, but after looking at pictures from the K7 vs. pictures from the D90 at ISO 3200, no explanation was needed as to which was the winner, the D90 of course!I have compared cameras from Canon 40D and 50D and the Pictures seen at High ISO, Pentax K7, Sony A700, and each time at the High ISO 1600 or higher the D90 seemed to always win. However, I think the closest Competition for the D90 would be the Sony A700 as it seemed pictures were good at High ISO 1600 or Higher, BUT ONLY AFTER Sony done a Bug fix on the Camera with the Latest Version Upgrade V4. I will update after a couple of weeks use

Reviews.Title: Cheap lens
Reviews.Author: Person
Reviews.Content: The lens has a plastic connector piece. The cheap quality of the mounting plate causes lens problems.My lens plate broke and won't mount back on the camera.

Reviews.Title: REPLACED IT WITH A d5000
Reviews.Author: Yasha's Mom
Reviews.Content: I bought this and then returned it.  I like the movable viewing screen on the D5000 much better.  Also the lens connection is plastic.  My nephew bout the D90 and had to pay a fortune to get it repaired less thn 60 days later.As an aside.  BE CAREFUL IF YOU BUY THIS THROUGH AMAZON.  For two months they told me they had  received and were processing my return. Then said it would be any day.  30 days later when I still had no credit I called again and they said they had no record of it being returned. It's 5 months later and I'm still out $1183 trying to correspond with mythical people.The problem is that Amazon only accepts emails through a form. And they don't copy you on the form.  So you have no proof that they ever received what they sent you.  Then they send you a response and you answer it, but get an automated form back that says they can't receive emails.A REAL HORROR STORY.

Reviews.Title: camera it needs a few modifications  but its ok other than that
Reviews.Author: William Atkinson
Reviews.Content: Some times this camera misses pixels and when your going back to edit you can clearly see a missing pixel or three i miss my  Nikon D3100. Why is this one more expensive you ask.  well its probably because of the lens which is pretty good the lens is great but tech of this cam  could use a few improvement when it comes to shooting against black backdrops other then those minor details  the camera is great and i wouldn't want to dis persuade anyone from buying it . it is definitely a great but but Nikon has this issues with some of its cameras some times just pointing that out its not the first time I've come across this problem when using a Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Lovely!
Reviews.Author: LKP
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after being a Nikon D40z owner for several years.  I work at a photography studio, where we use Nikon D200.  As of now, I finally could afford something better, than the D40x.  However, since the D200 is a bit outdated as of now I didn't want to go that route.  The D90 was a great set between the D40x and a D300- which I aspire to get in the the near future.  It has a built in motor, so all AF nikon lenses are compatible, which was a nightmare with my D40x.  I'm happy with this purchase.  Also, its really great in lowlight situations!

Reviews.Title: Thank you
Reviews.Author: nilsun
Reviews.Content: Thank you for selling this camera with only body option. So I also bought the lens seperately which one I need. Price is also reasonable. Nothing need to say about the product it self of course :)

Reviews.Title: EXELENT SELLER AND PRODUCT WILL ALWAYS BY TO THEM
Reviews.Author: gia
Reviews.Content: IM VERY HAPPY WITH MY NIKON D 90 AND THE SELLER THE SHIPPEMENT EVERYTHING WAS JUST LIKE THEY SAID EXELENT CHOISE, IT TOKE FOR ME A WHILE TO READ A LOT OF SELLERS BUT THIS WAS MY EXELENT CHOICE LOVE IT THANK YOU

Reviews.Title: Big upgrade....
Reviews.Author: Jaime Gonzalez "Jaimeluisgg"
Reviews.Content: Coming from a D40, D90 is another world ......I was trying to buy the D7000 in place, but I read a lot reviews online, many D7000 leaking oil, and other problems .... backfocusingI'm just an amateur, so do not need high ISO handling (still ).....I bought the D90 body only with a 70-300mm lens.Now I am looking some money to buy flash units compatible with CLS .....!Greetings from Venezuela .....

Reviews.Title: D40 Owner
Reviews.Author: John Staehle "John Staehle"
Reviews.Content: I own the original Nikon D40 with an assortment of lenses and filters picked out over the years, the original lens with the body is quite acceptable and with addititional lenses now numbering 3 total I am confident my photos will be a hit. I already have over 90 posted here that show off my handywork in scale models and now with an up-coming book that I will be having online through Amazon I will be doing fairly well. With a strong background in general film photography that was taught to me by my father, an inventor for Eastman Kodak for over 40 years I accomplished many tasks in photography with him looking on and being a serious critic, no shutterbug in my lifetime. The idea of wasting film was forbidden in the family inspite of him bringing home hundreds of rolls of experimental film, sold later as ASA 100, 200 and even 400. The age of digital finally caught up to me and the Nikons SLRs that I owned were all but manual as I learned from the beginning to use such settings as "auto" was almost unheard of.My use of my old film camera brought me into the realm of freelance photography and in doing so won me a spot in two feature stories about the SW parts of the USA including areas near Monument Valley but considerably less known. That led to freelance journalism and writing about local events that go on around the Deming, NM area including moving of the historic railroad depot that has now been lost to history as a bus terminal and classroom, shameful!My D40 and photography experience of over 50 years led me into teaching photography at a local college with the idea to introduce digital photography to not only novice photographers with all digital cameras at hand but to folks like myself transitioning to digital after years of film camera knowledge. My opening introduction in every class was that "it is the photographer behind the camera that makes the photos, the camera only conveys that which the photographer interprets" That statement usually got people on the right track for digital and supprisingly the purchase of D40s and near-realated other digitals went up among class members.The best to all,John

Reviews.Title: D-90 Nikon camera body only.
Reviews.Author: Arland Phelps
Reviews.Content: The Camera was all that it was said to be.  It was on time and everything worked exactly as the add said,Nikon D90 12.3MP Digital SLR Camera (Body Only)

Reviews.Title: THIS CAMERA is SO worth your $$
Reviews.Author: Molly Jones
Reviews.Content: This camera has been SO reliable. I love it and it produces professional quality images.  TOTALLY worth it.The only CON about this camera that is ind of annoying is the there is no auto focus for the video camera.

Reviews.Title: Great New Camera
Reviews.Author: Licorice17
Reviews.Content: Great camera. I still have a lot to learn but I just set it on automatic and go.  Eventually I'll try all the new features but the pictures are great and the screen on the back of the camera gives you a great idea of how good your picture really is.  I'm having a great time taking pictures and driving everyone crazy with Smile!

Reviews.Title: nikond90
Reviews.Author: ragz
Reviews.Content: i like the camera, initially i had a tough time in understanding all those menu options. But now i am slowly getting used to it. I am able to take good pictures with it.

Reviews.Title: The Nikon D90 is Awesome!
Reviews.Author: dlv "Debbie"
Reviews.Content: I know that there are others that have gone into great technical explanations on the merits of the D90 and what it has to offer compared to other cameras - so I am not going to repeat those.  What I can say is that I am known for buying new cameras and always "upgrading"  - usually in less than a year.  I have owned the Nikon D40 and the D60 - both what I thought were great cameras . . . and then the D90 came along!  It blows those two right out of the water - so much so that I gave the D40 and D60 to family members because once I owned the D90 - the other two seemed UNWORTHY :)  I bought my original D90 in early January 2009.  I recently purchased another D90 body.  I just had to have a "spare!"  It is the best camera that I have every owned and I don't even think of casting it aside for a newer model.  It is a great price for what you get too!  I highly recommend the Nikon D90 to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Buenísima
Reviews.Author: Andrés Carafí "ANDRES C."
Reviews.Content: Es un agrado poder usa una cámara simple, pero poderosa.Estoy disfrutando cada oportunidad de poder sacar buenas fotografías.Excelente el lente de 18-200, da una gran amplitud para obtener fotos panorámicas y buenos acercamientos, muy versatil, super recomendable....

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: J. Choi "charlatan"
Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful.All the reasons have already been written.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera, hate the weight
Reviews.Author: Victor I.
Reviews.Content: I absolute love everything about this camera, except I don't know if I can keep it due to its weight.With the kit lense, I find that I can't really hold the camera for more than 1-2 minutes.  Additionally, I find my wrist starting to hurt when I hold the camera in one hand while adjusting the settings with the other.This really takes the fun out of using this camera. While I can take photos with it without difficulty, reviewing pictures for any meaningful time period is an impossibility.Do you think I can get used to the weight of the camera if I perservere?  I am in a tough spot because to reduce the camera weight at this point means sacrificing image quality and features.  I feel that going down to Canon 500d is a significant step down, but maybe I have to do it (d5000 is not an option due to low-res screen).Any tips would be appreciated!

Reviews.Title: Just Like Brand New
Reviews.Author: KenixOxineK
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for my dad and he really enjoys it. It works great and takes really awesome photos.

Reviews.Title: This camera is awesome!
Reviews.Author: Andrew Fortune "BigFortune1"
Reviews.Content: I had a 12 MP Digital Canon Rebel for about 6 months before someone stole it. I really liked that camera a lot and considered buying another one, but the lens on this Nikon was capable of so much more so I bought it instead. The Nikon is more precise and feels more stable. I definitely like the Nikon more. I just recently bought a nice flash for it and my pictures are amazing.The lens on this camera is my favorite thing. It has so much range for a single lens. I am not a professional, so I don't want to carry around different lenses for different shots. The lens on this camera is all I'll ever need.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: K. forbes
Reviews.Content: Im glad that i bought the d90.It a toss up between EOS 50d and nikon d90.It is an excellent camera.Moving up from pentax k100D which is also a very good camera too but only 6mp.They is alot to learn about the control and settings.Getting  familliar with the camera but not too complicate.I love the VR len it takes good photos without blurr.I had never use the video part yet.Im not planing to use it soon.I had HD camcorder for that.(canon HV20)The battery life also very good take alot of pictures before needing to recharge.I also bought a camera grip to go with it.

Reviews.Title: This camera rocks
Reviews.Author: David Muirheid
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital SLR camera.  I love the way it makes your friends jealous.  the low-light shots are low noise, and when used along with the SB-600 flash it takes killer flash shots. I really LOVE this camera, and find it easy for beginners (in AUTO mode anyone can get great pictures.) But it is also fantastically full of features for the experienced photographer.  The commander mode (wireless flash) lets you move your SB-600 away from the camera for nice shadows and awesome portraits.  the 18-105 lens is good if you only have one lens.  I even know faithful Canon owners that would like to try out this Nikon.  My pictures finally look very very good.  I think you have to go pro to beat this one.

Reviews.Title: D90 Camera
Reviews.Author: Leona "Pet Lover"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and being able to take movie clips is a really nice feature.

Reviews.Title: I'm not a professional, but I feel like it with this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: angel1533
Reviews.Content: I am not a photography buff, and I don't know a lot about cameras, but this camera is amazing! It has all the bells and whistles, but is extremely easy to use (with a bit of reading the manual). The pictures come out looking professional (of which I am definitely not), and I have started taking more pictures just because I enjoy using this camera so much! I have had it for 3 months, and the more I use it, the more I love it. I consider this camera an investment well worth the expense.

Reviews.Title: Great still camera, decent video camera
Reviews.Author: Ajit Anthony "ajit"
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for taking photographs. The video is soft and the codec is mediocre.

Reviews.Title: Problems
Reviews.Author: nightowl57
Reviews.Content: I am a photo enthusiast and have previously been shooting with a Nikon D50. I enter this review with mixed feelings. I received my Nikon D90 around Jan 4th this year and was instantly amazed with its ability. Because of my previous experience with the D50, it did not take long to get accustom with the D90 and was quite surprised at the ease of familiarizing myself with the new camera. I did try to read up as much as possible because I feel that is the most importand thing to do in photography, knowing your camera inside and out. For the first two weeks, I would say it performed beautifully,as expected. However shortly there after I began noticing pictures that were grossly underexposed speradically through a shoot. I shoot sporting events indoor with various lighting. Here are my usual settings. ISO-1600 to 2000 with High ISO NR on,WB-K at various settings depending on lighting, burst and single exposure modes, AF area mode-Dynamic area,Center focus point-wide,Meter-Center weighted. I shoot approximately 200-400 photos over a period of about 3 hours with several breaks throughout the session. Photos in question are almost completely backed out but look as though they are very underexposed with just hints of the subject on the outer edges. These photos will be scattered about the shoot so it has been very difficult to pinpoint exactly what might be going on to cause this but I have been very surprised with that this is happening. The last session, I had about 25-30 of these misshots in a little over 400 photos. The Customer Service Dept. has been very gracious and helpful to try to resolve this problem and after talking to Nikon USA and Amazon Support, I have a new camera being shipped as a replacement. I am very pleased with this as I feel like it is a defect with the camera and did not feel like this problem should be showing up this soon. The D50 never has had any problem like this but it does not have the setting capability that the D90 has, so I will not try to compare their performances. I hope the problem is with this particular camera and not the model. I am a Nikon fan and will continue to be but this is a discouraging chapter in my history with Nikon products. I will certainly update my review and star rating after I have had a chance to use the new camera.

Reviews.Title: Think twice
Reviews.Author: Ac Gomes Martins "Carlos Martins"
Reviews.Content: F--error (no lens attached) occurs very frequently. This is clearly a bad contact between the lens and the camera. Every time this happens I have to move a bit the lens or remove them and attach again. I would not expect this from a semi-professional Nikon!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Gary Shannon
Reviews.Content: This was an upgrade from a D40 which I really liked but this camera is much more sophisticated and my pictures seem to be much better. Although this was a used unit, it looks and works like brand new. I wouldn't hesitate to buy from this person again. Great transaction.

Reviews.Title: Very dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Juan Bautista Benza
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a less than a year ago and everything went more than perfect till three weeks ago when it started to show err in the display. The Nikon Service told me the repair costs around U$S 500. Very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: Nice one to buy
Reviews.Author: Prasanna Ranade
Reviews.Content: I am very happy that i bought this camera based on these reviews. Thank you guys for posting such a valuable RFR (reivews for reference)

Reviews.Title: Very Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: S. Anderson
Reviews.Content: I don't get very excited so much about stuff as I do about people. I bought this camera shortly after my grand daughter was born. I wanted a camera that would give me really good pictures of my family and what ever else.The pictures are so amazingly sharp, with great depth and color. I am so happy that we have captured amazingly life like moments with the D90. Well worth the investment.Looking forward to a life time of really great quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: So good
Reviews.Author: Khoa
Reviews.Content: Look is not new like the comercial.anyway, Thank for your product.It work perfected.Thank you,Hopefully, Se you late.Khoa

Reviews.Title: D90 - Great Buy
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. I dont use it for the movie feature I have a Sony HD Handy Cam for that. But this camera is awesome. I didn't buy the kid - I have plenty of Nikon stuff...but this is a must have for the creative photographer.

Reviews.Title: A real camera - Recommended
Reviews.Author: PABLO FLORENTINO "Pablo Florentino"
Reviews.Content: Until now, all shots I've got have presented a great quality and diference in comparison to non-SLR cameras.The flash is really powerfull. The camera is easy to manage, you just have to spend sometime reading manuals and testing it.

Reviews.Title: Surprised and surprised again, this Nikon is a keeper!
Reviews.Author: HoraceHorse "Wind&String;"
Reviews.Content: I own and have used amateur cameras for a very long time. It is rarely today that I am so impressed. But this Nikon, as pleasing as some of the great cameras of the past, compels me to recommend it to you.The central attraction for me, a picture taker not a camera operator, is the ease with which I can make great shots having very few settings to deal with. Night shots are outstanding, and this an inbuilt option on the function selector makes such things very easy to do.! No fiddling or tweaking needed nor required. Consider what used have to be done to get such shots.Like another camera that I still use and love, Kodak Z710, I can opt for PASM shots if I want to experiment, and on the Nikon D90 DSLR the results instantly displayed on the large screen on back making corrections very easy.But for those of us not into fiddling with such settings, preselected set-ups for the most popular shots are built into the D90, all set out on a function dial on the top of the camera. These are, Auto, Flash-Off Auto, Portrait, Landscape, Close-Up, Sports and Night-Portrait as well as PASM.Which brings me to the supplied 18-105MM DX VR AF lens. Very nice for the price offered here, and it surprises with every shot, all of which are good! BTW.Even though the quick start booklet is very well done, newbies to DSLRs will get more out of the larger user manual. In particular that warns against fiddling - even accidentally BTW - with the focus ring on the lens when the lens focus selector is set to auto.Buy the remote control - it lets you operate the exposure button when your camera is on a stand and you are the other side of the room!Nikon ML-L3 Wireless Remote Control for Nikon D40, D40x, D60, D80 & D90 Digital SLR Camerasand a lens cleanerNikon 7072 Lens Pen Cleaning Systemas well as an SD memory card.Sandisk 4GB Secure Digital SD HC Memory Card (SDSDB-4096, BULK, No Reader)and at least one filter to protect your investmentTiffen 67mm UV Protection Filter

Reviews.Content: Great camera best for one with knowledge of SLR's but for those who don't you should pick up the basics quickly. Great parts of more expensive cameras but at a decent price. Just get out there and enjoy

Another plus is a movie capture (here is a link to a video I posted on youtube: [...] ) it also is very good, but the only downside is it's manual focus. Over all very good camera and the included lens is also amazingly good.

Reviews.Author: bpow
Reviews.Content: I only used this camera with the 18-55 vr and the 50mm f/1.8. I had a nikon d5000 before and the picture quality was much sharper. The colors were similar. I recently sold this camera and anyone thinking of buying this should get the d5000 or the d7000 over this. The colors are usually a bit dull. Since shoot in raw the picture modes dont matter. I am upgrading to the d700. If you look closely at the sample images on the d90 you can see where this camera struggles with oranges and reds. The blues and greens are excellent

Reviews.Content: Amazon's first rate service begins with ease of use check out, fast FREE shipping and accurate description of their products.  The Nikon D90 is an amazing camera that take beautiful photos and the video is much better than some reviewers will lead you to believe.

Reviews.Title: D90

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: msdar
Reviews.Content: Camera came on schedule. I've been playing with it waiting on photo class to start at local collage I am anxousto learn allI can.

Reviews.Title: A DSLR convert thanks to the D90
Reviews.Author: E. Souza
Reviews.Content: The D90 is my first foray into the realm of D/SLR photography and it's largely been a joy thus far. I think the standard kit lens offered for this camera is a good choice for people like myself in that it provides some room for growth and discovery and some basic methods to go more hands on (zoom and manual focus ring), as is the whole point of venturing into SLR territory.  The camera itself isn't as daunting as it might first appear, since the central control scheme built around the main and sub command dial is an intuitive interface.I could be happy strictly with the JPEG output of this camera and how the Picture Controls allow you to set that output.  It can produce sharp, accurate pictures they way I like them while also providing for a full gamut of control over hue, saturation, sharpness, etc.  With the nice, large LCD and some basic tools built into the camera for post-processing (like crop and straighten), I've found myself willingly using these tools for on-the-spot post-processing more than I ever have with similar tools on point and shoot cameras. But, as I've started to dabble with the RAW format, it's hard to deny that the much deeper post-processing capabilities in a "digital darkroom" like Nikon's own Capture NX software aren't alluring.  It's a shame though that Nikon doesn't include the full Capture NX software for their DSLR customers and sells it separately at significant cost.  At the price the D90 goes for, I think Capture NX should be included as part of the package.A few other minor issues prevent the D90 from a perfect review for me.  The contacts between the kit lens and camera have been fickle for me, often requiring lens reseating to dismiss an annoying "F--" error message that prevents picture taking until resolved.  It's the first camera I've owned to corrupt a flash media card (and a nice high speed 4MB card, no less) - it only happened once thus far and there's no way to be sure that it was the camera and not just a bad card but the first is the worst, as they say.  Finally, in the time I've owned the D90 and having gained some familiarity with the features offered in the rest of the Nikon line of DSLR, there's certainly a few missing that I wish the D90 had.  Interval shooting, for example - that one is at the top of my list.But none of that changes the fact that the D90 has successfully converted me to the world of digital SLR photography, happy to be here.  It's small foibles and omissions aren't enough to distract from its inherent proficiency as a robust photographic tool and its overall build quality.  I look forward to growing into SLR photography with this camera for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Emko
Reviews.Content: The D40 was my first DSLR and decided to upgrade when they announced the D90. I'm so happy I did; its well worth the money as a camera alone,the movie mode is honestly a bonus, and works well also!

Reviews.Title: Nikon D90  'CHA' 'F--' Error
Reviews.Author: M. Sanderson
Reviews.Content: I received several errors ('CHA', 'F--') that made use of the camera impossible after 1 week of use; only way I could turn camera off was to remove batteries.  Without the error, I would have rated the camera with 5 stars. If it seemed like a rare error I would have exchanged it for a replacement; however, it appears as if a non-trivial number of users have had same experience.Amazon did provide a complete refund and I'm struggling with whether to go down to a D40 or switch to Canon.

Reviews.Title: I knew it was used, but I thought it came in perfect condition

Reviews.Content: Camera does not recognize SD card, compartment memory card is bad. I know it was used but did not think it came with those details. The lens is good and the flash also works well
